programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: West adversaries in the Wild and Kraken complete disappointing seasons. Minnesota has won six of eight meetings after claiming a pair by a combined 8-2 score in 2023-24. The Wild's Kirill Kaprizov totaled two goals and two assists in those games.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Oilers and Avalanche wrap up their regular seasons with a potential West final preview. The clubs split the first two meetings this season with both played in Edmonton. Colorado takes on Winnipeg in the first round of the Stanley Cup playoffs.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: West adversaries in the Wild and Kraken complete disappointing seasons. Minnesota has won six of eight meetings after claiming a pair by a combined 8-2 score in 2023-24. The Wild's Kirill Kaprizov totaled two goals and two assists in those games.

programme.title: SportsCenter

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on the ESPN family of networks. It's highlighted by a lively roundtable discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. Seats at the table are reserved for folks in ESPN's stable of NBA hosts and analysts, with the latter group imparting wisdom based on their many years of playing experience.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Heat and Bulls duel in an East play-in game for the final playoff slot. Chicago got 42 points from Coby White to knock out Atlanta 131-116, while Miami fell 105-104 to Philadelphia and may have lost star Jimmy Butler to a knee injury.

programme.title: Professional Fighters League
programme.desc: From Wintrust Arena in Chicago.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on the ESPN family of networks. It's highlighted by a lively roundtable discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. Seats at the table are reserved for folks in ESPN's stable of NBA hosts and analysts, with the latter group imparting wisdom based on their many years of playing experience.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 4 Cavaliers face the No. 5 Magic in Game 1 of an East first-round set. Orlando makes its first postseason appearance in four seasons, and seeks its first series win since 2010. Orlando ousted Cleveland from the 2009 Eastern Conference finals.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Suns and Timberwolves play Game 1 of a Western Conference first-round set. Phoenix claimed 10 of the last 11 meetings with Minnesota, including a 125-106 decision in the April 14 season finale to bump the Wolves from a top-two seed in the West.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: No. 2 New York hosts No. 7 Philadelphia for Game 1 of their first-round series. The clubs last met in the postseason in 1989. The 76ers escaped the play-in tournament with a 105-104 win over the Heat behind Joel Embiid's 23 points and 15 rebounds.

programme.title: SEC Now
programme.desc: The flagship news and information program of the SEC Network -- ESPN's 24/7 multiplatform sports network devoted to the Southeastern Conference -- is "SEC Now," broadcast weekdays from the network's studios in Charlotte, N.C. Hosted by Dari Nowkhah, Peter Burns or Alyssa Lang, the show includes a mix of sports coverage, in-depth features, insider access, and exclusive interviews with the movers and shakers of the conference's 14 teams.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: From Bogle Park in Fayetteville, Ark.

programme.title: Formula 1: Grand Prix Sunday
programme.desc: Teams make final preparations for the day's race. Plus, interviews, features, and Martin Brundle's popular "grid walk."

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: The Formula One grid competes in the first Chinese Grand Prix since 2019. Lewis Hamilton is a six-time winner of this race, including four of the last six runnings. Max Verstappen returned to the winner's circle in Japan, but has yet to win in China.

programme.title: The Point
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship hockey show featuring highlights, news, analysis, speed, skill and access to the biggest stars, stories and personalities of the game. Hosted by John Buccigross.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Sunshine State rivalry hits the postseason as the Lightning and Panthers play Game 1 in the East's first round. It is the third time the clubs have clashed in the Stanley Cup Playoffs, with Tampa Bay taking both previous series in 2021 and 2022.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Capitals face the Rangers in Game 1 of an East first-round set. The clubs face off in the playoffs for the first time since 2015, which capped a run of five meetings in seven postseasons. Alex Ovechkin (WSH) has 13 playoff goals against New York.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Leading into each of ESPN's Sunday Night Baseball telecasts is this special edition of "Baseball Tonight." Host Karl Ravech teams with analysts and reporters to present fans a detailed preview of the network's exclusive, national game of the week. Highlights of the day's other games, interviews with players and managers, and key storylines from around the league also fill the hourlong show. Mark Teixeira, Eduardo Pérez, Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney are among the analysts.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Rookie right-hander Darius Vines and the Braves host the Rangers on Sunday Night Baseball. Vines yielded one run in 4 2/3 innings of his season debut in Atlanta's 6-1 victory at Houston on April 15. Texas counters with righty Michael Lorenzen.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Hey Rookie, Welcome to the NFL
programme.desc: NFL rookies get their first taste of professional football at training camp.

programme.desc: From Dickies Arena in Fort Worth, Texas.

programme.desc: Another look at the fight between Marvin Hagler and Thomas Hearns, which has become known as "The War." From Aug. 15, 1985.

programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: No. 2 New York hosts No. 7 Philadelphia for Game 1 of their first-round series. The clubs last met in the postseason in 1989. The 76ers escaped the play-in tournament with a 105-104 win over the Heat behind Joel Embiid's 23 points and 15 rebounds.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Suns and Timberwolves play Game 1 of a Western Conference first-round set. Phoenix claimed 10 of the last 11 meetings with Minnesota, including a 125-106 decision in the April 14 season finale to bump the Wolves from a top-two seed in the West.

programme.title: Hey Rookie, Welcome to the NFL
programme.desc: A staple of the annual AFC vs. NFC competition, the NFL's top players are set to participate in new and fan-favorite Pro Bowl skills competitions that showcase their football and non-football skills.

programme.title: Hey Rookie, Welcome to the NFL
programme.desc: NFL rookies get their first taste of professional football at training camp.

programme.desc: Doubles.

programme.desc: Highlights, news, reactions and opinions from the day in soccer.

programme.title: Bundesliga Soccer
programme.desc: Borussia Dortmund hosts Bayer 04 Leverkusen at Signal Iduna Park in matchround 30 of the Bundesliga. Leverkusen lost seven of its last eight Bundesliga away fixtures against Dortmund. The only exception in that run was a 5-2 victory on Feb. 6, 2022.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: National League West rivals in the Diamondbacks and Giants play for the first time in 2024. Arizona has narrowly won the last two season series after claiming seven of 13 meetings in 2023. Christian Walker (ARI) hit .333 with 10 walks in those games.

programme.desc: The undefeated Stallions (2-0) welcome the Showboats (1-1) to Alabama. Memphis tries to draw level with Birmingham atop the USFL Conference. Stallions running back C.J. Marable and quarterback Adrian Martinez enter Week 3 as the league's top rushers.

programme.title: Inside the NBA
programme.desc: This Emmy Award-winning studio show, which airs following each NBA telecast on TNT, is hosted by Ernie Johnson, with analysis from Hall of Famer Charles Barkley and NBA champions Kenny Smith and Shaquille O'Neal. It's a mix of highlights, interviews and hijinks, notably the verbal sparring sessions between the outspoken Barkley and his straight man, Smith. The show also welcomes various guest analysts throughout the season.
